block.p: Jenny Lee Held, a daughter of Gail and Herman Held of Chelmsford, Mass., is to be married today to Joshua Adam Small, a son of Paula and Charles Small of East Windsor, N.J. Rabbi Eric B. Wisnia is to officiate at the Royal Sonesta Hotel in Cambridge, Mass.
The couple graduated from Brandeis University, the bride cum laude and the bridegroom summa cum laude.

Jenny Lee Held, a daughter of Gail and Herman Held of Chelmsford, Mass., is to be married today to Joshua Adam Small, a son of Paula and Charles Small of East Windsor, N.J. Rabbi Eric B. Wisnia is to officiate at the Royal Sonesta Hotel in Cambridge, Mass.
The couple graduated from Brandeis University, the bride cum laude and the bridegroom summa cum laude.

The bride, 22, works in New York as the assistant director of Kesher, a social and cultural organization for college students that is run by the Union of American Hebrew Congregations. In September, she is to begin studying for a master's degree in higher-education administration at Columbia University Teachers College. Her father is the president of Quest Engineering Solutions, an electronics-product testing company in Billerica, Mass. Her mother is an administrative assistant at the company.

The bridegroom, 23, received a master's degree in chemistry from Brandeis and is now a medical student at New York University. His mother teaches the first grade at the Ethel McKnight School in East Windsor. His father is a bank examiner in New York for the Federal Deposit Insurance Company.
